page.title: 11BOUGHTON MOUNT
page.content: Boughton Mount Special School and Adult Training Centre were purpose-built about 25 years ago for children and adults who are mentally or physically handicapped, have speech difficulties, are partially hearing, partially sighted, maladjusted or epileptic. Mr Foster-Clarke, a local business-man and landowner, provided about 10 acres of land on Boughton Lane for the County Council to build the school and day-centre. The old house called 'Boughton Mount' was torn down to make way for them. Children on the school roll in 1971 numbered 78; now there are 87. There are 9 teachers and 1 head, 7 welfare assistants full-time and 3 part-time. The facilities have grown considerably since it opened, often through the generosity of local people and groups.
